data.title: +1 view range for the Allies Light Tank, following the ability to kill off husks in the Ore Refinery
data.body:
With the ability to destroy husks in front of the harvester dump spot, the light tank will have very few roles left on the battlefield.

+1 view range has been discussed frequently on and off the forums. It would have +1 view range above basic infantry (same as dogs), making it more attractive to use with infantry squads in the early to mid game. Especially when going Radar Dome tech before the service depot. It also will serve as a more useful scout unit all through the game, even late game (probing specific areas).

Regardless, having the same view range for the Light Tank as basic infantry, just doesn't make sense.

*Also, there's been discussions on increasing the ROT +2 (rotation of turret?) for the light tank. That will make it a bit stronger against light vehicles (e.g. flak trucks).

data.title: Replace deprecated OpenGL features with more modern replacements
data.body:
Depends on #10203 (which appears as the first 22 commits in this pr).

After #10203 (which this depends on, and appears as the first 22 commits in this pr) we are left with two legacy GL features that are deprecated and removed from more modern GL specs and GL ES.  This PR replaces them with their more modern equivalents:
- Quads → Triangles.
- Implicit / magic attribute names → explicit attribute bindings.

data.title: Fedora: SDK path could not be resolved
data.body:
Dear team,
I try to build playtest 2015-12-13 on Fedora 23 but it fails during the make all command with the following error:

```
$ make all
+ download_dir=./thirdparty/download
+ mkdir -p ./thirdparty/download
+ cd ./thirdparty/download
+ '[' '!' ']'
+ which nuget
+ '[' '!' -f StyleCopPlus.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f StyleCop.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f MaxMind.GeoIP2.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f SharpFont.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f nunit.framework.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f Mono.Nat.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f FuzzyLogicLibrary.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f SDL2-CS.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f Eluant.dll ']'
+ '[' '!' -f SmarIrc4net.dll ']'
CSC fixheader.exe
error CS8001: Warning as Error: SDK path could not be resolved
Compilation failed: 1 error(s), 0 warnings
Makefile:251: recipe for target 'fixheader.exe' failed
make: *** [fixheader.exe] Error 1
```

I wonder what the given SDK could be. I installed the following mono and sdl packages:

```
mono-addins-1.1-2.fc23.x86_64
mono-core-4.0.5-1.fc23.x86_64

mono-web-4.0.5-1.fc23.x86_64
mono-winforms-4.0.5-1.fc23.x86_64

SDL-1.2.15-20.fc23.x86_64
SDL2-2.0.3-7.fc23.x86_64
SDL2-devel-2.0.3-7.fc23.x86_64
SDL2_gfx-1.0.0-7.fc23.x86_64
SDL2_gfx-devel-1.0.0-7.fc23.x86_64

SDL2_net-2.0.0-3.fc23.x86_64
SDL2_net-devel-2.0.0-3.fc23.x86_64
SDL2_ttf-2.0.12-5.fc23.x86_64
SDL2_ttf-devel-2.0.12-5.fc23.x86_64
SDL-devel-1.2.15-20.fc23.x86_64
SDL_gfx-2.0.25-3.fc23.x86_64
SDL_gfx-devel-2.0.25-3.fc23.x86_64
SDL_image-1.2.12-12.fc23.x86_64
SDL_image-devel-1.2.12-12.fc23.x86_64
SDL_mixer-1.2.12-10.fc23.x86_64
SDL_mixer-devel-1.2.12-10.fc23.x86_64
SDL_net-1.2.8-7.fc23.x86_64
SDL_net-devel-1.2.8-7.fc23.x86_64
SDL_Pango-0.1.2-21.fc23.x86_64
SDL_Pango-devel-0.1.2-21.fc23.x86_64
SDL_sound-1.0.3-15.fc23.x86_64
SDL_sound-devel-1.0.3-15.fc23.x86_64
SDL-static-1.2.15-20.fc23.x86_64
SDL_ttf-2.0.11-7.fc23.x86_64

```

So what am I missing here?

Steps to reproduce:
1. take a Fedora 23
2. install the neecssary packlages mentioned above
3. download the archive, extract it
4. cd to the archive, make depedencies, make all
5. see the error

data.body: Fixes #5294.

data.title: Fix the StartsRevealed option of FrozenUnderFog being ignored
data.body:
Fixes #10228.

In `FrozenActor`'s ctor, the `NeedsRenderables` property is effectively being set to the value of the actor's `FrozenUnderFogInfo.StartsRevealed` field. Later in the ctor, the `UpdateVisibility` method is called, which ignores and overwrites the previous value. This change ensures that `NeedsRenderables` won't be unset by `UpdateVisibility` if it was already set. It will be reset to false by [this line in `FrozenUnderFog.TickRender`](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Modifiers/FrozenUnderFog.cs#L167) eventually.

data.title: Any way to have both fractions videos available? (Red Alert)
data.body:
As in topic. I was trying to get it to work with cd isos released on cncnz, or with video files available on PortableRA site.
Tried 'use CD' option, but it doesn't copy video files (and gets stuck on REDALERT.MIX, and I have to change it in content directory to lowercase).
Copying MAIN.MIX (and changing it to lowercase, obiously) does work, but I get videos from only one fraction. Tried naming it main1, main2, but didn't work.
So, after this description, I ask again: any way to have both available at the same time?

data.title: Remove Actor.IsDisabled in favor of using IsTraitDisabled everywhere
data.body:
As mentioned in #10235, it would be better to get this out of the way first before we remove `INotifyBuildComplete`.

Since the number of places that check `self.IsDisabled()` is rather large and some related traits are not upgradable yet, I think the roadmap should look like this (exact order or number of steps might change):
## 1.
- [ ] Make all traits that need to be disabled under certain circumstances upgradable, if they aren't yet (an exception is `DisabledOverlay`, as we already have a replacement in `UpgradeOverlay`)
- [ ] Check for `IsTraitDisabled` (in addition to `self.IsDisabled()`)
## 2.
- [ ] Remove `IDisable` from traits that implement it
- [ ] Replace it on yaml level for `Husk` (as far as I can tell, apart from the overlay there currently isn't anything that requires husks being disabled anyway)
- [ ] Replace it by granting upgrades on `Power`-related traits
- [ ] Completely remove traits that become redundant (`DisabledOverlay` and `DisableOnUpgrade`)
## 3.
- [ ] Remove any remaining `self.IsDisabled()` checks from code
- [ ] Remove `Actor.IsDisabled` and the `IDisable` interface
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29175073-remove-actor-isdisabled-in-favor-of-using-istraitdisabled-everywhere?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Replace INotifyBuildComplete with upgrade system (part 1)
data.body:
Provided the general approach gets approved, this PR will be the first of two or more to get rid of the (hacky) `INotifyBuildComplete` interface, disabling actors/traits during make animation via upgrades instead.

This PR gives `WithMakeAnimation` the ability to provide upgrades, migrates `WithBuildingPlacedAnimation` (playing when TD and RA construction yards place a structure) and `WithSiloAnimation` from `INotifyBuildComplete` to upgrades, and makes the `DisabledOverlay` trait upgradable itself, because we don't want it to be enabled while the make animation runs.

I intentionally kept the number of migrated traits small in this PR, for easier reviewing of the general approach.

using the damage state of the repaired actor.

data.title: Remove aircraft defaults
data.body:
- Removed those pesky aircraft defaults for `RepairBuildings` and `RearmBuildings` that were only ever useful in ra
- Merged common ra aircraft definitons

data.title: Implement mod loading from the support directory
data.body:
Allows loading of mods from both the game and the support directory (`\<user>\Documents\OpenRA\mods\` in this case)

Also unhardcodes mod logo and preview image paths. (This is a double-edged change because 1) it gives modders more flexibility with these; 2) it gives modders too much flexibility with these. Just saying.)

Also applies the new format to D2k. A follow-up PR will apply it to the rest of the official mods (for consistency).

Closes #8992.

data.title: Remember irc/lobby chat username
data.body: Now irc-username is not remembered i RC3, and I have to type it in every time.

data.title: Lobby crash due to yaml-hardcoded teams / spawns
data.body:
Game crashes in lobby under specific conditions. Attached picture explains how to reproduce the crash.

![openra_crash_report](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2159248/11810389/f92a18ca-a32d-11e5-8dea-cac8c4a59a68.jpg)

Note: should say "select another SLOT" under step 2.

Some clarifications: map has 4 slots, it defines the 1st slot to be team 1, spawn A and other slots to be team 2 with a chooseable spawn. I believe the bug happens because the game allows spawn A to be selected when slot 1 is unoccupied. When a player enters slot 1 and spawn A is already occupied, the game crashes.

I fixed the issue for now by hardcoding spawns so it doesn't keep crashing but should someone investigate this issue they can use this version of the map: http://resource.openra.net/maps/6611
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29139771-lobby-crash-due-to-yaml-hardcoded-teams-spawns?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Spy gets detected by enemy soldiers and flame towers
data.body:
I am using playtest 20151213
When playing the RA single player mission "Tanya's Tale", the spy gets detected by the soldiers and the flame turrets.
This makes completing the mission very hard, if not impossible.

I believe in the original game, the soldiers did not detect a spy. I am unsure about the flame towers, though.

data.title: ATTACK order immediately ignored or changed to MOVE order when VISION of target LOST
data.body:
Tested on **current bleed (2015/12/14)** 
EDIT: this was tested on skirmish mode

When a unit is given a direct attack command but the vision of the target is immediately lost (fog of war) it will either: 
- **ignore the command** (red target line is shown but disappears a bit later than usual, unit does not respond) 
  see clip here: https://imgur.com/MBiKzkH 
  or gif: https://media.giphy.com/media/3o8doTBgODOGKM2SmA/giphy.gif 
- **ignore the attack command and switch to "move there"** (red target line shown, switches to green, unit begins to move in that direction) 
  see clip here: https://imgur.com/HIgkFIc 
  or gif: https://media.giphy.com/media/d2Zd4S2ZBfy5LBaE/giphy.gif 

You could argue that units should **not chase actors that disappear under the fog of war,** but I say there should be a at least certain (or longer) time window before giving up. Current behaviour feels (player's perspective) like it's broken.

**This might also be a source of reported "attack does not work" issues,** since it feels that way if you don't notice the brief vision loss. 

PS: This has been a real pain to record (with the attack, move lines) and convert to web-friendly format. Any good screen capturing recommendations (60fps) without image compression? 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29105453-attack-order-immediately-ignored-or-changed-to-move-order-when-vision-of-target-lost?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
